column4: i have two ubuntu pcs, this one is online, the other is on a crossover connection into this one, and when i browse network places, it says windows network?
yes, i have that too - and mine is a standalone PC
do you know how to add my other pc there?
Places -> Connect to Server...
:  do you know how to find the ip of it :) ?
ifconfig
im lost :)
if i ever get internet on the other pc itll be a miracle
get to a command prompt and type 'ifconfig'.  Look for a line like "inet addr:192.168.0.10" or the like
sounds plausible.  try 'ping 192.168.2.10' from the other pc
: hrmm, 192.168.2.10 is this computer im on, there is no ip address for the other network card
you need to set one up on the other card and on the other machine - 'man ifconfig' will help
something like 'ifconfig eth1 192.168.1.1' on one  and then 'ifconfig eth0 192.168.1.2' on the other PC  (my eth# numbers are guesses)
Desktop (Capital D)
the desktop doesnt display anything
but i see the files in ~/Desktop
and i can't right clickon it
is this Gnome?
yeah
hmm. perhaps it's a gconf setting.  ALT-F2 "gconf-editor" and see if there's someting in /apps/nautilus/...
no, nothing in there :(
sorry, out of ideas for now :/
